boardgame.name: Pitman
boardgame.description:
There are 10 dice sitting on the table. The high bidder gets to roll the dice to see if they can match or beat what they have bid. You look at your cards, which let you know how many dice you can roll. One of your opponents says, 34!

You don't think you can beat them so you let them take the bid. I can roll 9 dice, they say but are they telling you the truth or not? If they roll 9 dice and get a total of at least 34 on all the dice they get all the points for that round. If they dont make their roll then you and the other opponents split the points and they get nothing.

You could call their bluff forcing them to show their cards. If they were telling the truth they get the points for the round without having to roll the dice. If, in fact, they were bluffing and could not roll 9 dice, you and anyone else that called their bluff get to split the points for the round and they get nothing.

But if you call their bluff you also run the risk of someone blocking that action which knocks you out for that round then youll get nothing. Do you take that risk?

To win at Pitman you're going to need to out bid, out bluff, and out roll your opponents to be the first to reach the designated score.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Ladybird Reflect
boardgame.description:
Ladybird Reflect is a Breakout game about a ladybird on a journey to find its lost children and it needs your help to get them back.

Mama Ladybird is a happy mother of little lovely ladybirds until one day a spider entangles them into a cobweb and abducts them. The angry mother has to break through various fruits and fight spiders, flies, frogs, and lice through 22 levels.
Your help is needed to break through lots of bricks and save the baby ladybirds!
Features

- Story mode - help the Ladybird free all its children!
- Survival mode - save as many baby ladybirds as you can!
-Two-player mode - play locally against a friend!
- A.I. mode - play against a computer controlled enemy!
- Special blocks - get a bigger pad or additional attempts by crushing specific collectables!
- Distracting enemies - don't let a spider or fly touch your pad or they will do everything to block your sight!
- Level editor - create your own levels and play them!
- Nine achievements - two of them are hidden and you can achieve all of them without buying the DLC.
- Ambient soundtrack - composed by ladybirds!

(from Steam Store page)

boardgame.name: Tip Top Taverns
Tip-Top Taverns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SideQuests: Tip-Top Taverns is a supplement filled with twenty different Taverns for your adventure, all featuring barkeeps and patrons, waitresses and staff, menus, drunkards, entertainment, bar fights, an unique adventure hook, and more! Each Tavern is fully fleshed-out, offering multiple pre-generated options, so when your party is in need of a bar, you will always be prepared. The twenty diverse taverns will feature trendy locales based on different races, intriguing locations, and — of course — the potential for interesting storylines and adventures. The taverns themselves don't adhere to a specific game system, so you can use them with any tabletop RPG. You can treat the twenty taverns as their own separate chapters, or even simply roll a d20 to decide which Tavern your players have ended up in… The choice is yours!

boardgame.name: More Simple Class Templates for Monsters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

DO YOU WANT PSYCHIC MONSTERS? BECAUSE THIS IS HOW YOU GET PSYCHIC MONSTERS!

Sometimes, you just need the players to face a creature that can kill them with the power of its mind. Occult power is fun, mysterious, and a great way to make a monster creepy... and wow some of those classes are complicated! Not sure how many levels of psychic to add to a flumph to make it a good foe at a given CR?

Well, now you don’t even have to think about it!

Now if you want a monster to be a kineticist, mesmerist, medium, occultist, psychic, spiritualist, or even vigilante, you just add what they need with the appropriate simple class template! And to make sure you can use psychic flumphs immediately, each class template comes with an example creature fully written up and ready to go!

And if you instead want a monster to also be an alchemist, antipaladin, arcanist, bloodrager, brawler, cavalier, gunslinger, hunter, inquisitor, investigator, magus, ninja, oracle, samurai, shaman, skald, slayer, summoner, swashbuckler, warpriest, or witch, also check out our original Simple Class Templates for Monsters!

boardgame.name: Whisper City Pro Wrestling
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whisper City Pro-Wrestling is the game of independent circuit professional wrestling set in a post-apocalyptic, Midwestern mill town!

Are you tough enough to make it as a wrestler in the rough-and-tumble 'burg of Whisper City? Create a professional wrestling character and start climbing your way to the top of the Whisper City Armory roster! Chase your title dreams and eke out a hardscrabble existence as a working-class grappler in the last vestige of human civilization left on Earth!

WHAT IS THIS?

This is Whisper City Pro-Wrestling, a new roleplaying game from Cuss World Books and Games. We are currently sourcing a playtest group to help us refine the rules so that we can get a final First Edition out by summer 2018.

WHAT’S IT ABOUT?

Whisper City Pro-Wrestling is the game of independent circuit professional wrestling set in a post-apocalyptic mill town. Think indie pro-wrestling in a Midwestern city, but with aliens, mutants, and supernatural entities as playable characters and lots of customization options.

boardgame.name: Quizminister
boardgame.description:
Danish quiz game about politics, for two to four players or teams. Each player/team starts with one tactics token of each kind: committee consultation, spin doctor, and alliance.
The board has six question categories, and if you answer correctly, you have to move to a category that no player/team is already on. Two correct answers in a row lets you visit any category. Three correct answers in a row gives you a random tactics token. The tokens allow for politicking and helping/hindering other players/teams.
The goal of the game is to get to the top of the "career ladder" by answering enough questions correctly.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Explorer's Quarterly
boardgame.description:
IN THIS ISSUE:
1: Editorial
1: 3 New Archetypes: The bush ranger, The bumbler, and the Jungle lord
4: A new boon: The animal ally
4: 3 new banes: Drunkard, Gambler, and the Brawler
5: Bare bones: Basic adventure ideas

EDITORIAL:
Expeditions untold-
With the tragic death of Robert “Borneo bob” Johnson earlier this year, Lost continent publishing quietly closed it’s doors to the dismay of their fans. Such a small press company just could not attract much interest and the publishing rights are up in the air for the moment.

With little hope of either the promised Explorer’s handbook or the Sky Corsairs of the Antarctic source book being published anytime soon I sought permission from Jill Johnson to publish this unofficial supplement to help cover the hopefully short gap before someone picks up the publishing right.

Until then, make up your own expedition untold into the Darker continent, and have fun.

-- From the introduction

boardgame.name: Photome's
boardgame.description:
Photome's, a.k.a. フォトムズ, is a co-operative game in which you place animals to be visible — or place 3D buildings to hide certain animals — to create your ideal city. Use your smartphone to check whether your ideal city is being built properly.

This game won first place out of 213 games in a Board Game Grand Prix event themed around 'Home', sponsored by a real estate company, Lifull Home's.

Publisher's summary
The rules are easy! A somewhat unusual cooperation game using a camera function. You moved to a fashionable city where various animals are entertained.

Take a photo and show off to your friends in this fashionable city where you will live from now on! Can you take nice pictures well?

It is the best award winning work chosen from among 213 submissions of the board game Grand Prix with the theme of "living".

ルールはカンタン！カメラ機能を使ったちょっと変わった協力ゲーム。
さまざまな動物たちであぶれるオシャレな街に引越したあなた。

boardgame.name: Crusader Kingdoms: The War for the Holy Land
boardgame.description:
After the miraculous success of the 1st Crusade in 1097, three Christian kingdoms are established in Outremer; the Kingdom of Jerusalem, the Principality of Antioch and the County of Edessa. But in 1144 the Crusaders suffer their first setback with the fall of Edessa at the hands of Zengi (the ruler of Mosul and Aleppo), which provokes the 2nd Crusade.

Crusader Kingdoms is a hand management game set in this era, in which up to 4 players control the main Christian or Muslim kingdoms of Outremer. Each turn players receive a variable number of cards that can be troops, events or response cards, and playing in alternate rounds they use them to try to expand their realm. The winner is the player controlling more areas at the end of the game.

The game includes a solo engine, and a two-players cooperative variant and play anywhere in around 1 hour (the solo version is even shorter).

Victory is determined by area control.

God of War: The Card Game
Бог войны. Карточная игра
戰神
갓 오브 워: 카드 게임
boardgame.description:
Ragnarök is coming. The fate of all existence is at stake. Is destruction inevitable, or are there ways to avoid ultimate cataclysm? The Norns, mystical beings of great power, have decided they will not go quietly into oblivion and have turned their attention to the well of Fate, Urðr, in order to find any possible way to stop Ragnarök. Looking deep into the swirling waters, they can foresee which potential combination of heroes, villains, battles, victories, and defeats might stop the end of all that is known — but will they find the right combination in time? Is there any true path to salvation at all? They must hurry and seek the true way through, before all is lost.

In God of War: The Card Game, players take on the role of the Norns as they try different combinations of heroes and events in order to stop Ragnarök. Each game is a new attempt to find the right key to saving Midgard from destruction. Players must work together, embodying mighty heroes such as Kratos, Mimir, Atreus, Brok and Sindri, and Freya. They will fight enemies and bosses from the popular God of War video game, but combined and remixed in exciting new ways, creating unique "What if...?" scenarios each time they play. If they succeed, the way forward has been secured and Ragnarök can be halted. Failure means the Norns will have to try again as only death and destruction lay along that particular path.

Each quest in God of War: The Card Game is made up of a mosaic of cards that recreate monsters and locations from the video game. Each quest's mosaic is different, and each card is double-sided, depending on whether a section has been destroyed or not, and each has special rules that go into effect when it is face up on the tabletop. Learning how each quest is won, as well as what strategy to employ, is key to victory.

As players progress, earlier quests have an effect on what comes after them. At certain points along their path, players must choose which quest they will complete. Completing one might grant a bonus, but quests left untouched result in dire permanent consequences as the players move forward. These choices and challenges lead to new strategies, making it so no two games of God of War: The Card Game are alike.

Heroes in the game have several elements that make them unique. Each comes with their own dashboard that explains their special abilities and health totals, in addition to tracking the number of cards a player can keep in their hand from round to round. Tokens are used to keep everything clear as heroes gain and lose health and build up their power so they can unleash a mighty special attack. Heroes begin the game with a unique starting deck of cards that will be augmented from additional decks as the game progresses. Players can construct their deck to focus on their strengths or look for ways to generalize their approach, preparing for future quests that lie ahead. Each hero also has a unique standee that indicates which portion of the mosaic they are facing. With multiple heroes from which to choose, numerous ways to build their deck, and various different quests to attempt, each game of God of War: The Card Game will be a new experience that will echo throughout eternity.

—description from the publisher

If you’re reading this then you’re already at least slightly interested in a weird little game about… that’s right, freight train hopping youths in 1930s America. If you’re still there, bear with me and let me elaborate.

Freight Riders is all about cooperative storytelling. Both the setting and the system lend themselves to this. During the Great Depression the people who we roleplay as, hobos, often didn’t own much more than the shirt on their back. By banding together and offering each other help, they got by. So, if Freight Riders’ niche historical setting and cooperative storytelling gameplay sound fun to you, let’s dive into the game!

Das geheimnisvolle Grand Hotel - Escape-Room-Spiel Können Sie die Geheimnisse des Grand Hotels lüften?
Schlüpfen Sie in die Rolle einer der Ehrengäste bei der großen Wiedereröffnung des Grand Hotels und versuchen Sie gemeinsam mit Ihren Mitspielern das düstere Geheimnis des traditionsreichen Hotels zu lösen. Nur gemeinsam ist es möglich, einen Weg durch die verschiedenen Räume des Hotels zu finden und die Rätsel, die in jedem Zimmer warten, zu knacken. Die Zeit läuft – nur 90 Minuten sind gegeben, um dem Geheimnis auf die Spur zu kommen und zu verhindern, dass der Aufenthalt für immer ist.
Dieses Escape-Game bietet Spannung und kniffligen Rätselspaß bis zur letzten Minute. Eine stimmungsvolle Geschichte und spannende Rätsel führen die Spieler von Hotelzimmer zu Hotelzimmer. Dort warten einfache bis schwierige Aufgaben auf sie, die im Team mithilfe des detailreich gestalteten Spielmaterials gelöst werden müssen. Anders als bei anderen Escape-Games bleibt das Spielmaterial hier unversehrt und garantiert so grenzenlosen Spiel- und Rätselspaß. Nur wenn alle Rätsel gelöst sind, finden die Spieler den sicheren Weg aus dem verwinkelten Grand Hotel. Schaffen Sie es nicht? Nun, dann stellen Sie sich lieber auf einen längeren Aufenthalt ein…
+ spannende Story + geeignet für Familien und Einsteiger + überdurchschnittlich viel Spielmaterial + besonders geeignet für große Gruppen + Spielmaterial bleibt unversehrt und ist immer wieder verwendbar + Tolle Extras enthalten: Faden- und Logikrätsel, Bilder- und Zahlenaufgaben
So wird’s gespielt: - Die Spieler sind als Gruppe im Grand Hotel gefangen. Die Räume des Hotels sind verschlossen und liegen als versiegelte Umschläge aus. - Das Spiel beginnt, indem die Spieler den ersten Umschlag öffnen. Die Rätsel und Aufgaben darin ebnen den Weg zunächsten Umschlag mit einer neuen Herausforderung. - Gemeinsam bahnen sich die Spieler den Weg von Raum zu Raum. Und jeder Umschlag birgt dabei neue Überraschungen und abwechslungsreiche Rätsel. - Nur, wenn die Spieler gut zusammenarbeiten, können sie das Geheimnis lüften und die Geschichte zu einem guten Ende bringen.
Inhalt: 9 Umschläge mit diversen Materialien 8 Einladungen 1 Spielanleitung
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Vocablos
boardgame.description:
Vocablos is a card game published in Argentina by the Tinkuy publishing house. The objective is to form words by combining the letters and syllables obtained during the game.

Nine cards are placed in the center of the table, face up. Each player must form words composed of at least four cards. for that you must use letters and syllables that are on the table. Then the used cards must be replaced and it will be the turn of the next player. At the end of the game, the one who has added the most points will win.

—description from the publisher


Game modes

Vocablo: Place nine cards face up. Each player must make words by combining the letters and syllables available on the table. The winner will be the one who achieves the most points with the "words" formed in a certain number of games.

Chinchón: Eight cards are dealt to each player and the remaining deck is placed on the table. The objective is to form words with four or more cards, taking some and discarding others. The first person to complete their game can "cut" the game. The player who manages to add 200 points will be the winner.

boardgame.name: A Short Hike
boardgame.description:
Hike, climb, and soar through the peaceful mountainside landscapes of Hawk Peak Provincial Park. Follow the marked trails or explore the backcountry as you make your way to the summit. Along the way, meet other hikers, discover hidden treasures, and take in the world around you.

boardgame.name: Kurierzy
boardgame.description:
In this game you play roles of couriers during World War II, attempting to deliver as many messages as possible to various cities in Europe. At the same time you have to avoid German patrols both on land and sea.

You are one of the real historical figures, like Jan Nowak-Jeziorański, the famous "Courier from Warsaw", Jan Karski or Elżbieta Zawacka.

Your deck of cards enables you to travel via land and sea routes or to hide safely in certain cities. You can pick up one message at a time and if you manage to deliver it safely, you are rewarded with points and a new card to improve your deck by allowing for more effective movements. Sometimes you can also influence movements of German agents to clear your way or block it for the opponent.

The game ends when certain number of messages has been delivered, and the courier with most valuable accomplished missions wins.

boardgame.name: Papillon: Beyond the Meadow
boardgame.description:
Though clouds of butterflies have gathered from the meadow, birds, bugs, and other animals also call it home. Each creature provides new challenges for cultivating your garden. Your goal as a gardener is simple: maintain a balance.
Beyond the Meadow contains all of the unlocked stretch goals from the Papillon Kickstarter campaign. These modules include predators, birds, fountains, and even a solo variant. This expansion also includes new wildflower and bee tiles, as well as 15 goal cards for even more game play options!

boardgame.name: Kalmar
boardgame.description:
This is the game about your city, Kalmar. You buy, sell and trade properties and building plots to win. You will feel at home on the game board, going from Norrliden to Varvsholmen. Cards with pictures and instructions take you from familiar and unfamiliar situations and locations in the historical, contemporary and future Kalmar.

Players assume the role of landlords, purchasing and trading streets, squares and properties. Players landing on the streets and squares of other players must pay rent depending on if the plot is empty or if properties have been built on the plot. The unique plots for the squares Larmtorget, Stortorget, Lilla Torget and Skvallertorget, and for the local newspapers Östran and Barometern, are unbuildable, meaning that the rent is fixed; buying more of the same set garners you more money when players land on those plots.

Players play the game by rolling two dice, adding the sum together and moving on the game board equal to the sum of the dice. Players may only buy properties that are unowned, and it takes owning all streets of an individual color set to be able to build properties on the streets. For example, to be able to build properties on Norrliden, Funkabo must also be owned by you, as it belongs to and completes the orange set. While moving along the board, players may also land on tile which force you to draw cards, whose effects may be both beneficial and disadvantageous.

The goal of this game is, by the roll of the dice and mercantile shrewdness, to be the last player left with money, having forced your competitors into bankruptcy.

—description from the designer

boardgame.description:
User summary

The game consists of 4 stages, and also contains a point-multiplier system that allows for high score hunting.

boardgame.name: The Hive
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventure begins with Queen Bea approaching the party, she needs to find mighty adventurers to save her hive that has been taken over by an evil wasp queen. The queen is soft and fluffy, and very earnest. She smells of clovers. Queen Bea has magical rings made of petrified beeswax that when worn make you small. She has the rings to accommodate royal visitors from other lands, but no-one ever visited before now.

Will you enter and save the hive from Queen Vespa?

This is a systemless two page dungeon adventure that we created live on stream! This dungeon is designed with extreme usability in mind, to be slotted easily into whatever campaign you are running, spanning over one or two sessions.

boardgame.name: Masque of the Worms
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the haunting themes of Edgar Allan Poe to your table!

Baronness Elenore Rennet has yet to return home from a masque at Moldavia Manor two nights ago. Can the players find her and uncover the hideous secrets brooding inside the grim estate of Count Moldavia?

Masque of the Worms is a 1st-level one-shot originally written for a live playthrough by the Castle Mac crew in the courtyard of the Edgar Allen Poe Museum in Richmond, VA. Check out their fantastic performance on the Castle Mac YouTube channel!

This adventure is for 4-6 players and takes 3-5 hours to complete. It's optimized for the live-streaming, one-shot format, but makes for a spooky and thrilling session at any table. It is sure to make even the bravest hearts shudder!

Masque of the Worms includes:

Events inspired by Edgar Allan Poe's darkest tales
Fast pacing and big reveals ideal for live-streaming and online play
Two new monsters sure to chill your blood
Combat cards for each monster, PC, and special treasure
High-quality digital maps for use with virtual table tops

boardgame.name: One Hit Wonder
boardgame.description:
A band-battling game for two to four players to rock and roll the dice!

You are a musical artist. You have your eyes set on one goal: playing a successful show at The Ultiplex, the greatest concert venue in the land. To do it, you'll need to use your inspiration points to write and practice songs, recruit bandmates, and keep their egos happy, or else they'll leave you to start a solo career (or worse, join an opponent's band). Along the way, you'll live the artist lifestyle, and work your way up to The Ultiplex with gigs at the dive bar Midnightly, and the hipster cafe the Artful Baboon.

To play songs, you roll a 12-sided die and add up any artist or bandmate bonuses you have. A strong performance will earn you a "Good" result, and an epic performance earns you a "Sick" result. Each venue requires a certain number of songs played "Sick" in order to have a successful show. You'll carefully craft your set-list, with songs requiring different instrument combinations to play: keyboard, drums, and guitar. Make sure you stroke the ego of your guitar-playing bandmate Tennessee, because if she leaves you, you're never going to play that "Anthem That Glorifies Being Young and Lost" or the "Song with a Catchy Chorus but No Verses."

Turn up your speakers, tune your guitar, and try to become a One Hit Wonder!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Minotaur
boardgame.description:
Minotaur is an easy to learn, hard to master 20-minute tile laying game. In a one-player game you play Daedalus, the master builder in charge constructing and sealing shut a labyrinth while Minotaur hunts for you and the unfinished exit. A second player can take over as Minotaur in a two-player match.

On each turn select a labyrinth section from the Builders Board, and a location to build it atop a grid of randomly arranged land tiles. Your choices impact what labyrinth sections you have available on your next turn, and the direction and distance that Minotaur moves. Different types of labyrinth sections are blessed by different Greek gods, giving Daedalus an edge if used at the right time.

Earn points for building along rivers, lose points for building on vineyards, and don't let the Minotaur reach you or the exit before you finish! Earning and placing pillars will help slow Minotaur's progress and earn extra points.

In a two-player game Daedalus has less influence on Minotaur's movement, which is now controlled by the second player. Minotaur can topple and carry away pillars built by Daedalus, and steal labyrinth sections before they are set in place in order to build temples. Both players may build temples to different gods to thwart each other's progress.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Takayama
boardgame.description:
Takayama is a dexterity game to play alone or with unlimited players. The goal is to build the highest mountains by stacking the various pieces of wood, measuring them and summing these measurements to reach 100 cm. The first player to reach 100 cm or more wins.

Each player builds his mountain during turn by turn. The smallest player starts. In front of him, he places the base of the mountain (wooden board) and the tokens with the symbols facing down. He randomly turns a first token, takes the piece of wood with the corresponding symbol and places it on the wooden base. The player has the right to place it on the position he chooses, but only on the edge ! This is the first part of the mountain.
Next, he turns a second token, places once again the corresponding piece of wood on the previous piece and continues to build his mountain. The player may, at any time, decide to continue or interrupt his construction. If the player is satisfied with his mountain, he stops, measures its height and writes down the score. The next player can start. If, on the other hand, the player continues and his construction collapses, his score will be zero for that round and the turn of the next player begins.

boardgame.name: Vedo doppio
boardgame.description:
Vedo doppio is a pattern recognition game.

There are 14 cards with 8 objects and 28 cards with 1 object.
The basic rule of Vedo doppio is that, drawing 2 cards with 8 objects, there are exactly 2 objects in common. Whoever spots the 2 objects in common on both cards picks up the correspondent card.

There are 5 different ways to play. The first 3 games are related to the basic rule described above, the other 2 games are different and, for example, require memory.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: NEBUTA BEAT
boardgame.description:
In Japan, there are summer festivals known as Nebuta Matsuri. The most famous one takes place at Aomori, and is considered as an intangible national treasure in Japan. During the festival, huge floats (Nebuta) are paraded through the town, depicting brave warrior figures or kabuki style heroes and gods or just local celebrities, and dancers walk alongside dressed in special costume (Haneta). They perform a sort of bouncing dance as they walk, and call to the mass of tourists to join in. The call is a sing-song, Rasserā (ラッセラー), and they sing "Rasse ra, Rasse ra, RasseRasseRasse ra". In addition, there are Crow Dancers, Karasu-zoku (カラス族 "crow gang"), who act to disrupt the festival.

Nebuta Beat is a party game to simulate the rhythmic chanting and dancing. Each player gets a specific dancer card, showing their colour and their own dance move. The players stand around the table, taking turns to play a card from their hand to the centre in rhythm with the chant. All the players keep up the chant, Rasse ra, Rasse ra, RasseRasseRasse ra, and according to which cards are played (by colour and form), different players must perform their correct slow bouncing dance steps. If they make a mistake, they get cards as a penalty, until a score is reached.

Publisher's description
"NEBUTA BEAT" is a card-driven, real "dancing" game. NEBUTA is a Japanese famous summer festival. You can experience the festival by this game. Let's dance and jump!

Components
30 Haneto (Dancer) cards
15 Karasu Haneto (Crow dancer) cards
5 Assigned pattern cards

NEBUTA BEATは、青森ねぶた祭りをテーマにした、祭り体感型カードゲームです。

あなたはハネトとなり、ねぶた祭りの掛け声と共に跳ねて跳ねて跳ねまくってください！
NEBUTA BEATは次の３つのパートを繰り返すゲームです。

①ラッセラー！
②ラッセラー！
③ラッセラッセラッセラー！

①ラッセラー！でカードを出すハネトが次に出すカードを準備し、
②ラッセラー！でカードを表にして出します。
③出たカードの模様、色で指定された人が踊ります！

単純で楽しい！運動不足も解消！みなさんもNEBUTA BEATでラッセラー！しませんか！

boardgame.name: Builders of Blankenburg: Fields & Flocks
boardgame.description:
Add a whole new element to your adventures in Blankenburg with the addition of the Fields & Flocks expansion. Not only does Fields & Flocks add six player support to the game, but it introduces the Harvest phase, where you are able to direct the actions of your serfs in managing your agricultural holdings. Grow crops and raise livestock, either selling them to the various citizens in the town for silver, or attaching complete fields and flocks to structures for additional prestige. Fields & Flocks also includes more Characters, Citizens, Visitors, and Events, so each game is a unique experience.

Most new action takes place during the Harvest phase. This adds a worker placement mechanic to the game, where your serfs can interact with Fields and Flocks, as well as Citizens and structures. Depending on the Citizens in town and the structures in play, different strategies are available.

As an added bonus, the expansion comes with a full reprint of all cards from the base game. These will be printed on higher quality card stock, along with a switch to symbols instead of color bars on structures and the inclusion of district symbols to avoid confusion and aid color blind players. Some art which originally came out darker than anticipated will be rebalanced to ensure everything looks great.

The final enemy is hope.

A storm has raged within sight of the Twilit City for generations, never wavering and always slowly advancing. This is no ordinary squall of rain and wind, however; malign intelligence beyond mortal grasp stalks within, toying with the petty lives of adventurers and wanderers as a cat toys with string. boardgame.name: Castle Amber
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An Expansion and 5e Conversion Guide to Dungeon Module X2

X2: Castle Amber (Château d'Amberville) was originally published in 1981 as Dungeon Module X2 for the Dungeons and Dragons Expert Set. Written by Tom Moldvay, it is widely regarded as one of the greatest D&D modules ever written... and it is certainly one of the most bizarre of the classic adventures. The original adventure was designed for 6-10 characters of levels 3 to 6. It was, however, an exceedingly lethal adventure. I have converted this module for use with 5e characters between level 6 and 10, including multiple difficulty options for each combat encounter. The result is well over 100 pages of content including stat blocks for over 40 monsters (often with multiple variations), over 25 detailed NPCs, and over 30 magic items.

This adventure is easily used with any setting that allows for strange magic and interplanar travel, but I have added specific adaptations to allow it to fit within the Eberron campaign setting. I have included a few notes on how it could be used with Ravenloft as well.

Please note that the original adventure is required to use this conversion.

boardgame.name: Gishes & Goblins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You've played a lot of games before, about elven wizards going into dark caverns to vanquish dragons. Well, here's another one.


Nine races, including elves, halflings, and half-ogres!
Four classes, each with three sub-classes, from druid to warlord!
Forty-Two feat-like things, for further customization!


Eighteen skills!

Ninety-Eight spells, across seven ranks of spellcasting!
Forty-Five monsters, with simple guidelines to make more!
One, unified d20 mechanic, which you'll probably find familiar.


Real talk, though. Every one of these games has the same races, classes, and spells. Every game uses a slight variation on the same mechanics. You want to know what this game has, that others don't. Consider the following:


Simplified stats. You don't need to figure out the stat, then convert it to a modifier, and then never check the actual stat score again. You just add your whole stat, whenever it would be relevant!
Meaningful progression. You actually get better at defending yourself, at the same rate you get better at hitting!
Training matters more than your basic stats. A fighter who is trained in History will know more about history than a wizard who is not!
Low-level wizards have enough spell slots to feel useful, but there aren't any infinite-use cantrips that would make magic feel trivial!
Slower healing means you don't need to cram 6-8 combats into every single adventuring day, just for them to have some impact!
Monsters are actually capable of defending themselves. A boss monster can be a match for three same-level adventurers, all on its own!


Yes, it's another one of those games, but you haven't read this one yet! Maybe it will suit your own vision, as it suits mine. If nothing else, maybe it will give you some ideas for how to develop your own game!

boardgame.name: 100 syytä liikkua Säkylässä
boardgame.description:
100 syytä liikkua Säkylässä

100 reasons to exercise in Säkylä

A roll-and-move game for 2-6 players that want to discover Säkylä΄s varied exercise offerings.

Players roll the die and visit locations marked with a number or a color.

Numbers correspond to cards that contain a location, a short description of the surroundings and a task that they have to complete in order to discard it. Colors correspond to actions that result in players taking, giving or exchanging cards.

The tasks are miming various activities, sports or situations.

Alternatively, players can discard a card if they answer multiple-choice questions related to Säkylä sports, or pick up and execute Stretch cards that instruct the players to stretch in various ways.

The game ends when all players have reached the start/end location, and the winner is the player with the fewest cards.

—user summmary
